chapps.rest.routers.common module

Common code between routers; mainly dependencies

chapps.rest.routers.common.adjust_associations(cls, *, assoc, assoc_op, params=None, response_model=<class 'chapps.rest.models.TextResp'>, engine=Engine(mysql://chapps_test:***@localhost:3306/chapps_test))

Build a route to add or subtract associations

chapps.rest.routers.common.create_item(cls, *, response_model, params=None, assoc=None, engine=Engine(mysql://chapps_test:***@localhost:3306/chapps_test))

Build a route to create items.

chapps.rest.routers.common.db_interaction(*, cls, engine=Engine(mysql://chapps_test:***@localhost:3306/chapps_test), exception_message='{route_name}:{model}', empty_set_message='Unable to find a matching {model}')

the db_interaction decorator requires a couple of parameters, and provides optional arguments to override the messages for either of two eventualities: 1. any exception occurs; the argument list is automatically appended 2. the set of return values (from an access operation) is empty, OR

a delete operation could not find any objects to delete

Parameters

  • exception_message (str) –

  • empty_set_message (str) –

chapps.rest.routers.common.delete_item(cls, *, response_model=<class 'chapps.rest.models.DeleteResp'>, params=None, engine=Engine(mysql://chapps_test:***@localhost:3306/chapps_test))
chapps.rest.routers.common.get_item_by_id(cls, *, response_model, engine=Engine(mysql://chapps_test:***@localhost:3306/chapps_test), assoc=None)

Build a route to get an item by ID: first argument is the main datamodel for the request named arguments supply the DB engine for session creation and the Pydantic response model for the output the optional dict assoc maps the names of associated models onto the data model for the associated objects

chapps.rest.routers.common.list_associated(cls, *, assoc, response_model, engine=Engine(mysql://chapps_test:***@localhost:3306/chapps_test))

Build a route to list associated items with pagination

Parameters

assoc (chapps.rest.dbmodels.JoinAssoc) –

chapps.rest.routers.common.list_items(cls, *, response_model, engine=Engine(mysql://chapps_test:***@localhost:3306/chapps_test))

Build a route to list items. The factory just needs the control data – the engine, the response model The returned closure expects to receive the query parameters as a dict, since that is what the dependency will yield.
